bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raymond O. Dart, April 29, 1948

div1.p: Hench informs Dart that he will bring Reed materials for exhibit at the International Congress of Tropical Medicine. He appreciates the ongoing search for an English translation of Carlos J. Finlay's work.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raymond O. Dart, April 29, 1948
div1.opener:
April 29, 1948
Colonel Raymond O. Dart
Director, Army Institute of Pathology
7th Street and Independence Avenue, S. W.
Washington 25, D. C.
My dear Colonel Dart:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of April 22. I will bring with me
on May 11 the yellow fever data which I have loaned to the University of
Virginia.

My train arrives in Washington in the middle of the morning.
How will I make arrangements to have the exhibit opened. I don't believe
you told me where the exhibit will be. If you can do so, please tell me
to whom I shall telephone or where I shall go late the morning of May 11,
perhaps around 11:00 to set up the exhibit. I will be leaving Rochester
May 6, going first to New York and Charlottesville.

I appreciate your further search for English translations of
the works of Dr. Carlos Finlay. I have the book which you mention in
your letter of 22 April. I also have the Selected Works of Finlay which
contains a few translations but of most of these papers I have found no
English translations and appreciate your help.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
